summary: The Emerging Innovative Border Technologies Act mandates that the Secretary of Homeland Security develop a plan to integrate and deploy advanced technologies to enhance U.S. Customs and Border Protection's capabilities. This plan must include details on technology assessment, procurement, privacy impacts, and collaboration with various departments and the private sector. The bill also authorizes CBP Innovation Teams to research and adapt commercial technologies, and requires annual reporting on their activities, including pilot projects and programs. The Secretary must consider the costs and benefits before large-scale deployment.
